description.narrative: The Information and Communication Technology Development Project supports two key pillars of the Bank's Country Assistance Strategy (CAS) for FY03-FY06, which is based on the Comprehensive Poverty Reduction and Growth Strategy: 1) High growth through transition to a market economy - by developing policies for the information communication technology (ICT) sector; and, 2) Adoption of a modern public administration, legal, and governance system - by enhancing the efficiency and transparency of government operations, through the implementation of government portals, online applications such as business and land registration, e-procurement (online registration and notification/publication of tender awards), improvement of online statistics collection and dissemination, and in general, expanding the Web presence o f government services, will improve government decision-making processes, lower transaction costs, improve the quality o f documentation and standardization, and limit discretionary actions and the scope for corruption. The project comprises five subprojects: 1) ICT Leadership and Modernization will strengthen the capacity of Ministry of Posts and Telematics (MPT) in the development, implementation, and oversight of the government's national ICT strategy and policies; strengthen its capacity to formulate telecommunications and ICT policy; and, improve its operating efficiency and effectiveness. 2) General Statistical Office (GSO) Modernization will support the implementation of the strategic plan for the modernization and capacity-building of GSO. This entails improving the quality, transparency, and timeliness of socioeconomic and poverty-related data and information. 3, 4 and 5): E-Government in Hanoi, Danang, and Ho Chi Minh City. Activities under these components will support the enhance of the ICT environment in those cities, provide the basic foundation for

MIC, GSO, HANOI AND DANANG DICS

title.narrative: Danang: Enhance the efficiency in Management of Water Source's Quality

comment.narrative: no system exists.

target.value: • The Water Monitoring System launched.• Raw water is monitored and controled 247 on criteria (Colour, Smell and Taste, Muddy,Residual Chlorine, pH, Amoni content, Chloride content, Fluoride content, Asen content, Coliform) before treatment/processing step.

actual.value: •The system is in operation•Raw water is monitored and controlled 247 on criteria (Color, Smell and Taste, Muddy, ResidualChlorine, pH, Amoni content, Chloride content, Fluoride content, Asen content, Coliform) before treatment/processing step.

comment.narrative: Fully achieved the project end target.

title.narrative: Danang: Enhance the efficiency in Public Transport Management

comment.narrative: no system exists.

target.value: • The Public Transportation Management launched.• 100 percent of buses are managed centrally and based on GPS and GIS MAP.

actual.value: •The system is under commissioning with 100/100 buses equipped with GPS devices (the new bus route has just established with 14buses equipped with GPS devices.)•The quality of provided bus services is monitored centrally at the operation center ofDepartment of Transport

comment.narrative: Fully achieved the project end target.

title.narrative: Danang: Improved transparency and reduced transaction costs (i.e. time) for Construction Permits

comment.narrative: no system exists.

target.value: • The Construction Permits System launched and integrated into the city-Portal.• 30 percent of applications online. (subject toproject extension)70 percent of users satisfied with the Contruction Permits System

actual.value: The system is completed development phase and under commissioning. To be completed by November 15, 2013.

comment.narrative: This indicators will be fully achieved by the project closing.

title.narrative: Hanoi: Improved ICT awareness and managment capacity through training

baseline.value: Lack of IO and CIO awareness and knowledge of how ICT can play a role in improving administratice processes and government services

target.value: + 340 leaders and key official receive CIO training+ with HAN9 has been done: ICT HR Development Masterplan for Governmentagencies of Hanoi as well as for developing ICT industry and ICT applications for social and economic organization, orientedenterprises and aims to use in next 10 years

actual.value: 30 leaders were trained in Singapore in 2011.

comment.narrative: Training for SME was initially planned by the project fund, but implemented by the local fund. As a result, more than 100 SMEstrained by local fund.

title.narrative: Upgrading ICT infrastructure to support eGovernment technical capacity in MIC, GSO, MOFA, Hanoi, and Danang

target.value: Total 5.Completion of 5 internal ICT network (LAN network)1. MIC and 12 DICs2. GSO,3. MOFA,4. Hanoi5. Danang

actual.value: Completed in MIC DICs. Almost completed in Danang, and MIC HQ. Still under implementation in MOFA, GSO, and Hanoi, but all are inthe final stage (user acceptance text and end-user training). Will be fully completed by the project closing date.In Danang, 27Departments, 8 Districts, 56 Wards/Communes have LAN and Internet connections. In addition to that, the Metro Area Networkproviding Fiber Optic Cable Connection between 87 state agencies of Danang city is under operational commissioning. 30 additionaldepartments/agencies were equipped (DNG15)In MIC, several IT equipment for intelligent communication system such as videoconference, IP phone, building security system was implemented, and used regularly.Video conference, LAN networks and other ITequipment( i.e. PC, laptops, printer…etc.) were installed at 12 DICs.

comment.narrative: 80% achievement.GSO, MOFA, and Danang are at the final stage of completion (user acceptance stage) of ICT infrastructureupgrading. There has been some delay in Hanoi. Hanoi cancelled packages in June 2013 due to accumulated implementation delays,which would affect the PDO achievement, but the impact would be relatively small compared to other locations.

title.narrative: MIC: Time savings of new systems (3 licensing e-services and visa online service)

baseline.value: There are lengthytransaction times andhigh costs (bothformal and informal)associated with manygovernment services.

target.value: Radio spectrum:Processing time shortened from 20 to 10 business days.Publication:Processing time shortened from 10 to 5business days.Registration for imported publication:Processing time shortened from 30 to 15 business days.Transaction time forvisa processing will be reduced (at least one visit by applicant)

actual.value: - Radio spectrum: Processing time shortened from 20 to 10 business days.- Publication: Processing time shortened from 10 to 5business days.- Registration for imported publication: Processing time shortened from 30 to 15 business days.- Finished theinstallation at Bureau of Consular Affairs & Department of Foreign Affairs of HCM. Started using the software at these sites.

comment.narrative: Current achievement rate is 85%. (Time saving by new visa online service will be monitored by the end of the project.)

title.narrative: Number of G2B services available online (Hanoi and Danang)

comment.narrative: The project targeted 3 G2B service available online, namely: business registration service (Hanoi, Danang), and public procurementservice (Danang).

1 G2B service is operational (business registration service in Danang).Note: Public Procurement service in Danang was canceledand implemented by own govt funding. Business registration system is under implementation in Hanoi.33 % target achieved.

title.narrative: Reduced transaction costs, increased transparency and users' satisfaction of selected government services through e-applications (Hanoi, Danang)

target.value: Transaction time will be reduced by one and a half time.

comment.narrative: E-services are under implementation. So far, 1 G2B service isoperational (Businessregistration servicein Danang.), but costreduction rate and user satisfaction rate have not yet measured (just finished development phase).At Hanoi:Currently, there are 3level public services implemented online by Hanoi DIC. And the time of online transactions is reduced in comparison with thetraditionalway. They are: + Issuing license for publishing documents without business (transition time is reduced to 4 days from10 days)+ Issuing license for organization of press conferences (transition time is reduced to 2 days from 5 days)As of October2013, time saving and cost reduction survey has not yet done, but by the end of the project, the full survey willbe completed.Probability of achieve the project end target will be around 80-90%.

target.value: • 7 Districts and 56 Wards/ Communes use e-Districts / e-Wards system.• 100% one Stop-Shop are used at Districts and Wardslevel.• Business Process Database for Public Service is established and used as a unique source of Public AdministrationProcesses.• Management Information System is launched.At atleast 90 departments/ agencies are established Video ConferencingSystem.

actual.value: + 90 departments/ agencies provided video phones (113 video phones) and ip phones (400 ip phones); The video conference serviceestablished.+ Development of Business process Database for Public Service is completed and under commissioning.+ Development ofManagement Information System is completed and under commissioning.+ E-wards/e-Districts is completed and under commissioning.+100% one stop-shop used at Wards and Districts level being connected via MAN and transferring data to Department of Home Affairs.

comment.narrative: Fully achieved the project end target.]

title.narrative: Number of e-services and socio-economic information available through eGateway (MIC), portal sites (GSO, Hanoi, and Danang)

comment.narrative: 5• 3 licensing e-services of MIC available online (launched in May 2013).(Radio transmitter permission, registration ofpublications by Publishing Houses, Registration of imported publication portfolio), and application process was completelyconverted to e-transaction (no more paper-based application accepted.) • Danang: 1-gate service is implemented, up and running.•GSO portal is completed, up and running• Hanoi one-gate services portal are under implementation.As of October 2013, 5 out of 6targeted e-services were implemented and operational. Hanoi one-gate service portal is delayed. Hopefully it will be all completedby Dec 15, 2013.

title.narrative: Danang: Improved transparency and reduced transaction costs (i.e. time) for business registration and investment licenses

baseline.value: Business registration and license processing done offline

target.value: • The e-Business Registration System launched and integrated into the city-Portal.• 70 percent of users satisfied with thee-Business Registration System)• Investment Project Management System is implemented• 80 percent of investers applying theirapplication for investment license online.

actual.value: Business Registration System and Investment Project Management System) have finished development phase. No survey has beenconducted yet.

comment.narrative: Beneficiary survey is planned in end-Nov to December. The final survey results will be ready by the end of December, 2013.]

title.narrative: Danang: Better access to government services through different channels

baseline.value: City government services are provided and processed through various departments and locations.

target.value: Danang Public Wifi with its coverage over public areas of Danang CityDanang City Portal with links to otherdepartments/districts/communes/wardsPublic Service Information Portal and Public Service No 881888 (Public Contact Center)launched to provide information about public services, tourist, social-economic information.10 information kiosks providingtourist information are installed

actual.value: Contact Center in place (via number 881888) to provide information on public services, social-economic issues.Danang MANconnecting 95 Departments, Agencies, Communes and Wards.32 internet stations are installed at communes & wards where internetaccess is limited10 information kiosks providing tourist information are in placeSetting up public Wi-Fi Access Points has beencompleted and public Wi-Fi is available at free of charge now until further pricing business model is introduced (DNG12).Additional Wi-Fi Access Points are under commission (DNG 15)

comment.narrative: Fully achieved the project end target.

title.narrative: Hanoi: Number of public services available through City Portal

baseline.value: City government services are provided and processed through various departments and locations.

target.value: The one stop software for government agencies has been intergrated in Data Center, the citizens could, through this one stopsystem, receive public service from state agencies. - Intergration of 57 Portal/Website of Departments. - Intergration of publicservices for citizens through internet: nearly 2,000 public services at 2nd level, 8 services at 3rd level and 2 service at 4thlevel was delivered at the end of 2012. - Through that, achieving targets as follows:+ Transaction time will be reduced, +Citizens will be more convenient + Citizen satisfaction of the citizens with government will be improved

actual.value: Data center to host the City Portal is completed Related software of Portal have been installed in this DC . City Portal isunder implementation. So far, 18 department portals and 16 applications are integrated with Hanoi City Data Center to providecitizens and enterprises with easier/ more reliable access to government information and services. 3 portals are planned to beintegratedto the City Portal

comment.narrative: It is still under implementation. Current achievement rate is around 70 % of the project end target. It will likely achieve thetarget.

title.narrative: Danang: Number of city officials take training and IT training courses

baseline.value: City officials have limited awareness of ICT use and management at national scale

target.value: • At least 27 leaders have received CIO training• At least 30 leaders have received training in ICT Strategic Management• Atleast 400 officials have been trained in IT

actual.value: •27 leaders and officials have received CIO training program.•08 IT technicians received overseas IT training courses. •Total102participated in overseas study tours. (two in Singapore & Malaysia, one in Taiwan, one in Australia, one in UK)•141 officialshave received in IT training (CCNA, MCSA, Oracle DB, Database, Networking)•400 officials participated end user training (DNG 10b)

comment.narrative: This indicator is fully achieved.

title.narrative: GSO: Number of survey database available trhough GSO portal

baseline.value: Data disseminated in hard copy format, very limited statistical information prov ided online. Takes about 15 days to address datarequest.

target.value: More than 60 percent of databases are integrated through data warehouse and available through GSO portal

actual.value: GSO portal and centralized data warehouse is now underuser acceptance test phase. All databases are migrated to new datawarehousesystem and available through GSO portal. Official launch is planned by the end of November 2013.

comment.narrative: The project will fully achieve the target by the end of project.

title.narrative: Hanoi: Reduction of time required for one transaction of selected government services through City Portal compared to the traditional way

baseline.value: Hanoi:It takes 14 days for an enterprise to complete the business registration.Danang: Business registration and licenseprocessing done offline

target.value: Transaction time through the one-gate system will be reduced about one and a half in comparison with the traditional way (e.g. 5days in business registration)

actual.value: No data available(City Portal is under implementation.)Currently, there are 3 level public services implemented online by HanoiDIC. And the time of online transation is reduced in comparison with the traditional way. They are: + Issuing license forpublishingdocuments without business (transation time is reduced 4 days)+ Issuing license for organization of press conferences(transation time is reduced 2 days)

comment.narrative: This indicator may fail to fully achieve due to the delays of City Portal implementation.

title.narrative: MIC, Hanoi and Danang: Improved ICT awareness and management capacity through training

baseline.value: Lack of IO and CIO awareness and knoledge of how ICT can play a role in improving administrative processes and government services

target.value: • 400 CIOs/IOs trained in which 260 CIOs/IOs from Gov agencies, 140 CIOs/IOs from state own enterprise• 1000 MIC staffs trainedonpolicy formulation, capacity building and implementation guidelines for IT, telecommunications, post and ICT insurance securitysectors

actual.value: MIC: • 497 CIOs/IOs trained (277 CIOs/IOs from ministries and 63 DICs, 150 CIOs/IOs from state owned enterprises, 70 CIOs/IOsfromSMEs)• 947/900 MIC staff trained in which:• + 621 staff trained on ICT technical issues• + 88 staff trained on ICT projectmanagement • + 138 participants trained on overseas courses on ICT management and technical issues• + 100 participants in 14study tourson e-government and public services, etc.• 60 participants from 60 e-commerce enterprises trained on ICT forEnterprice• A numberof laws, decree and circular issued by MIC to guide business, citizens, gov agencies to implement

comment.narrative: This indicator almost achieved the target.3 trainings are planned before the project closing.

title.narrative: GSO: Improved capacity of staff in performing streamlined and IT-enable GSO processes

baseline.value: Lack of awareness and knowledge of how ICT can play a role in improving administrative processes and government services

target.value: 670 GSO and PSO staff trained and/or accredited

actual.value: 122 CIOs trained and certified; 83 GSO staff and IT experts from 3 IT Centers trained at Network Administration; 395 GSO and 63PSSO staff/statisticians trained MS Office; 27 IT experts of 3 IT Center trained at SQL/ Share Point/ .Net Window ServerTotal 690trained.

comment.narrative: The project fully achieved the project target

title.narrative: Formulation and implementation of ICT policies and common standards in MIC

baseline.value: Limited capacity to formulate policies and guide implementation on latest issues in ICT sector. Gap in policy instruments

target.value: The following three standards are formulated:Enterprise Architecture, interoperability, and e-government framework and security.

actual.value: EnterpriseArchitecture (EA) andinteroperabilitystandard wereformulated. e-Governmentframework andsecurity are underimplementation.

comment.narrative: 2 out of 4 targets were completed (EA and Interoperability standard). E-Govt Framework and security are in the final stage, o befully completed by December 2013.

title.narrative: GSO: Time saving of new data management and report generation through database integration

baseline.value: Limited number of stand alone databases some of which contain redundant information.No data standardization or integrationmethodology.Monthly reports generated manually.

target.value: Common SSIC system setup to support GSO for new statistical surveys and periodic data collection. 2 GSO departments using SSIC aspilots. Plan for remaining 6 departments to move to SSIC. This will result with at least 30-50 percent in overall turnaround timeas IT centers do not need to develop statistical applications which will be done by the business user through the automated surveyapplication tool.

actual.value: Three out of nine sector databases (population, SME, and BDS) developed; data standardization and integration methodology beingdeveloped; population reports automatically generated.SSIC system has beenimplemented at GSO HQ and 3 ITCs, the system is nowready for conducting two pilots survey (Enterprise and CPI). Enterprise survey is annual survey April every year, so pilot will berolled out in April 2014. CPI is monthly survey, pilot will be rolled out in November 2013.Completed the end user training on Sep14, 2013.

comment.narrative: The project completed all activities related to this indicator. We are still waiting for the actual time saving data from CPIpilotsurvey planned in Nov, but the project end target is more likely to be fully achieved.

title.narrative: GSO: Improved data transfer through local area network (LAN) connection between GSO and Provincial Statistical Offices (PSOs)

baseline.value: Many of the PSOs are not connected to GSO and data exchange occurs only when there is a specific request for data

target.value: Communications between GSO and PSO greatly enhanced with collaboration capacities provided such as:- 100% PSOs and 3 IT Centersconnected to GSO through WAN VPN network solution, and improve data transfer between GSO departments and PSOs.- Emailinfrastructure upgraded to provide secured exchange of documents and official corespondence.- Network connectivity ofr EA for GSO.

actual.value: All PSOs and 3 ITCs havebeen connected with GSOHQ via virtual private network using MPLS andpublic Internet connectionNewemail system has been officially used in entire GSO since Aug 15, 2013.

comment.narrative: The project fully achieved the project end target.

title.narrative: Danang: Design and implementation of city-level government IT architecture

baseline.value: No IT architecture to connect the various departments in Danang.

target.value: 91 authority units are aligned to IT architectureE-Government Enterprise Architecture Framework and Model for Danang city isapproved by the Danang People's Committee.Report of strategy, roadmap, architecture, standard, and prototype of e-government ofDanangcity is prepared and approved.

actual.value: + Danang E-government Enterprise Architecture in place+ 27 Departments, 8 Districts, 56 Wards/Communes equipped+ 56 wards/communes have LAN and Internet connections+ The Metro Area Network providing Fiber Optic Cable Connection between 87 stateagencies of Danang city is under operational commissioning (DNG5a).+ 30 additional departments/agencies were equipped(DNG15)Total 121 units achieved.

comment.narrative: Highly achieved than the project end target

title.narrative: Danang: Improved ICT infrastructure of the city government

baseline.value: No significant ICT infrastructure developed in the City Government.

target.value: Danang Metro Area Network prividing fiber connection to at least 90 Departments and Agencies is implemented.Data Center isimplemented.Danang Public Wifi with its coverage over public areas.Training and Applied Research Center is in place includingDanang Elearning Portal is in place.Danang eGov Framework is implementedAll departments, agencies, communes and wards areprovided with end-user IT equipments to serve their business activities

actual.value: •Danang Metro Area Network is completed.•Development of public Wi-Fi is completed and 165 public Wi-Fi Access Points areavailable to the citizens at free of charge now until further pricing business model is introduced (DNG 12).•Additional Wi-FiAccess Points are completed (DNG 15)•Danang Data Center is completed•e-learning Portal is completed, up and running.

comment.narrative: This indicator is fully achieved

title.narrative: Danang: Number of participants from SMEs take IT training to enhance IT skills for their business and activities in e-commerce, e-procurement, and e-services

baseline.value: Only 20 percent of SMEs use ICT, and only 5 percent do so for business operations

target.value: 1000 participants from SMEs trained in e-commerce, e-procurement, and applying e-services.All SMEs are supported with necessaryinformation for their business activities via Contact Center (76% public services related to SMEs: 1,250 Administrative Proceduresofthe total number of 1,641 ones)400 courses in ICT and soft-skills are available in Elearning Portal.At least 75 softwaredevelopers of SMEs received Software Engineering training courses.

actual.value: + SMEs are well-informed about the current services provided to them via the Contact center. E-learning Portal is launchedhttp://multimedia-lab.org400 courses in ICT and soft-skills are available in E-learning Portal (including 15 learning modulesspecifically targeted to SMEs).73 software developers have been trained in Requirement Management (DNG10b-5.2), Software ProjectManagement (DNG10b-5.3), Software Testing (DNG10b-5.4)Basic IT knowledge training program are showed on the television 3days/week. Just finished on Oct 28. The program contents were uploaded in the website, and hit 27,000 viewers.

comment.narrative: Waiting for more detail information from PIU.

title.narrative: GSO: Time saving of survey data collection and processing through new system (data scanning, capture, and processing)

baseline.value: Previous census data collection and processing process was 12 months (for data capture only)

target.value: • Form Scanning Infrastructure to support future large scan census projects with expected 50 percent improvement inprocessingFordata entry, expected improvement around 30 percent- 50 percent after project finish in june 2013 for IT enabledprocessing

actual.value: Census 2009 data collection and processing took 8 months (for data capture and processing). Applying the scanning to Agriculturaland Rural Census 2011. Forms Scanning infrastructure re-used for Rural and Agriculture Census (estimate 50% improvement in overallprocessing time reduced from 2 years to 1 year); package for System of Statistical Information Collection (SSIC) is under finalUser Acceptance Test. SHS is under finalization and will be completed by the end of November 2013.

comment.narrative: As a result of successful implementation of SSIS, GSO estimates that data collection and processing for CPI survey will be reducedfrom 15 days to 10 days. The project end target will be most likely fully achieved.

title.narrative: MIC: Completion of 3 licensing e-services and the visa online service offered to businesses and citizens available online

baseline.value: There are lengthy transaction times and high costs (both formal and informal) associated with many government services.

target.value: 3 licensing e-services available online (1. radio transmitter permission; 2. registration of publication plans of PublishingHouses; 3. registration of imported publication portfolio of publishing companies), and visa online service.

actual.value: - 3 licensing e-services launched in May 3, 2013 (e.g. radio spectrum, publications, registration of imported publicationportfolioof publishing companies) which are completed and being in use.Full converted to e-transaction. No more paper-basedapplication is accepted.- Visa online system is completed and installed 95 visa offices worldwide. As a pilot, operation startedfor the applicationin Vietnam since Sept 16, 2013. Full deployment will be planned by November 30, 2013.

comment.narrative: Current achievement rate is 90%.

title.narrative: MIC: Design and implementation of e-Government framework, common IT standards and ICT policies

baseline.value: There are no guideline and framework to develop the e-government application in the country. Lacking IT standardnationwide.Lacking the IT standard in nation wide

target.value: • E-government framework is in place to guide all provinces and government authorities to implement e-government services• Commontechnical and application standards for e-government are issued such as email integrated system; • A number of laws, decree andcircular issued by MIC to guide business, citizens, gov agencies to implement including:- 02 Laws (Postal Law and Law of RadioFrequency) + 01 draft of Law of Information Security- 01 Decree of the Government about Managing of Investments on Applications ofInformation Technology;- 01 Decision of the Prime Minister about the national planning of information security;- 01Directives ofthe Prime Minister about strengthening the implementation of information securing activities- 10 Circulars of Ministry ofInformation and Communications about the application of information technology;- 02 Decrees of MIC about the application ofinformation technology and information security;- Several Decisions on national standards on info

actual.value: + TA on e-government Framework and IT applications standard is under implementation.+ The integrated email system documents arefinalized and being in use to develop feasible study of e-mail national system project belong to the national program of ITdevelopment. + Supporting to promulgate a number of laws, decree and circular issued by MIC to guide business, citizens, govagencies to implement including:- 02 Laws (Postal Law and Law of Radio Frequency) + 01 draft of Law of Information Security- 01Decree of the Government about Managing of Investments on Applications of Information Technology;- 01 Decision of the PrimeMinister about the national planning of information security;- 01 Directives of the Prime Minister about strengthening theimplementation of information securing activities- 10 Circulars of Ministry of Information and Communications about theapplication of information technology;- 02Decrees of MIC about the application of information technology and informat

comment.narrative: Project fully completed the project end target, and nothing more expected.

title.narrative: MIC: Quality and security assurance for ICT services in Vietnam improved through core MIC service

baseline.value: Vietnamese telecoms policies do not yet meet international standards

target.value: Upgrade of root certification authority (CA) to perform advanced PKI services. System in place to issue digital certificates tocitizens and businesses to allow digital signature. Test Center established to evaluate IT products by IT companies fore-government

actual.value: N/A(under implementation –MIC1.2: finished installation at both office and backup sites, building documents for create keys,acceptance test procedures and end-user documents – Will be finished by Nov 30, 2013.MIC1.3: finished installation of hardware, isactivating the installed software and bulding end-user manual – Will be finished by Nov 30, 2013)

comment.narrative: This indicator will be achieved by Nov 30, 2013.

title.narrative: Danang: Improved transparency and reduced transaction costs (i.e. time) for vehicle registration and drivers license

baseline.value: drivers license was procedded offline

target.value: • The Driving License System launched and integrated into the city-Portal• 70 percent of users satisfied with the new DiversLicense Systems

actual.value: No survey has been conducted yet.•Driving License System: development phase has been completed.• Preparing deployment forcommissioning and user acceptance test.

comment.narrative: Beneficiary survey is planned in end-Nov to December. The final survey results will be ready by the end of December, 2013.

title.narrative: Danang: Enhance and develop the ICT Human Resources in Danang City

target.value: • Danang's ICT HR Development Master Plan is approved by Danang People's Committee• e-learning Portal is launched• 400 coursesin ICT and soft-skills are available in e-learnng Portal.• At least 75 software developers in both public sector and privatesector received Software Engineering training.• At least 27 leaders have received CIO training• At least 400 officials have beentrained in IT .

actual.value: •Danang's ICT HR Development Master Plan was developed and approved by Danang People's Committee •e-learning Portal launchedand up and running (http://multimedia-lab.org)•400 courses in ICT and soft-skills are available in e-learning Portal.•73software developers have been trained in Requirement Management, Software Project Management, Software Testing

comment.narrative: The project will most likely achieve the project end target.

title.narrative: Increase number of private firms using ICT and e-services

target.value: 500 managers of SMEs trained how to apply IT in their enterprises by MIC; 1000 SME trained how to use e-services that DanangCityprovides. 60 percent of SMEs use ICT in their business, and 40 percent of SMEs use ICT Transaction Center in Danang.

actual.value: Danang:• SMEs are well-informed about the current services provided to them via the Contact center. • E-learning Portal islaunched in June 2013 (http://multimedia-lab.org)• 400 courses in ICT and soft-skills are available in E-learning Portal, andsince June 2013, total 268 people took e-learning courses.• More than 100 visitors for Basic IT Training Courses (DNG10b-7.1 with68 session• 73 software developers have been trained in Requirement Management (DNG10b-5.2) , Software Project Management(DNG10b-5.3), Software Testing (DNG10b-5.4)• Basic IT knowledge training program are showed on the television 3 days/week.MIC:•497 CIOs/IOs trained (277 CIOs/IOs from ministries and 63 DICs, 220 CIOs/IOs from state owned enterprises).

title.narrative: Hanoi: Design and implementation of city-level government IT architecture

baseline.value: No IT architecture to connect the various departments

target.value: A Master plan Design for EA of three level of government and a detail EA for Department, Ward and Commune wil be developed, basedon these, Hanoi will:- Develop e-government in better way. - Complete the development of administration for serving citizens andbussiness with more efficiency and transparency. Develop to IT architecture for 57 Departments, Districts in alignment way.

actual.value: under implementation

comment.narrative: + The main task (Task 3) - Design for EA of three level of government - is under implemented. Acceptance Committee gave commentsfor this report and Consultants is revising. Draft of Task 4 – develop this designed EA for a selected Department, Ward - is beingrevising under PIU comments. Task 5 training is underway.+ nearly 50% is completed. + It is expected to have this assignment(contract) completed by the end of November.

title.narrative: GSO: Design and implementation of GSO IT architecture

baseline.value: No IT architecture to connect the various departments in GSO. Low quality, accessibility and effectiveness in statistics servicedelivery to government and to the public

target.value: - GSO Enterprise Architecture in Place - EA artifacts captured in repository tool to facilitate more effective EAGovernance.Bridge the gap between GSO plans and IT for :- Centralized and coordinated IT services- Effective IT investment andprioritization decisions.

actual.value: GSO Enterprise Architecture is in place and all of IT initiatives at GSO must follow the standard from GSO EAGSO EA artifactshas been capture in System Architect softwareAll of IT investment for GSO must be align with GSO EABridge the gap between GSOplans and IT for :- Centralized and coordinated IT services completed through SSIC and SHS.- Effective IT investment andprioritization decisions. Fully achieved based upon the project activities

comment.narrative: The project fully achieved the project end target.

title.narrative: MIC: Completion of ICT infrastructure upgrade to enhance communications between MIC and DICs, and MOFA

baseline.value: Limited access to ICT infrastructure

target.value: • Improved ICT infrastructure for MIC and MOFA (conferencing facilities, smart building, portal infrastructure, datacenter)• Atleast 12 DICs equipped with ICT infrastructure, video conference and LAN network.

actual.value: + MIC completed the audio and video conference system, smart building, communication between MIC and its 4 agencies (Regional MICoffices in Danang, and HCMC, Telecommunication Authority located in Hanoi, Center of Internet in Vietnam located in Hanoi) Usageof video conference is: every month within MIC; every 3 month with MIC and DICs+ Upgrading infrastructure in DICs has beencompletedand accepted (MIC2.2).+ Construction of data center for MOFA is under implementation (MOFA1: installation & datamigrating (from existing system to the new one) completed – plan to launch from November 1, 2013. + e-Gateway (phase 2 MIC'sportal) is completed and being in use. [ www.mic.gov.vn]

comment.narrative: Completion rate 90%.
